item.title: Intro to Python
item.description: A glimpse into some python tools I have learned in my Computational Biology course. library(reticulate) import re Regular Expressions (regex) Regular Expressions search for defined patterns in a block of text. # Match restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG. Note that per the IUPAC nucleotide code, N is any base, R is A or G, W is A or T. string1="" re.findall(r"A[ATGC]TAAT",string1) ## ['ATTAAT', 'ACTAAT'] re.findall(r"GC[AG][AT]TG",string1) ## ['GCGTTG', 'GCAATG']

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
